sentences.english: But the tensions took on seamier aspects.
sentences.chinese: 但是，這種緊張關係以更醜惡的形式出現。

sentences.english: We are gonna publish their ugly faces.
sentences.chinese: 我們要把他們的醜惡嘴臉公佈於衆。

sentences.english: It is sad to think that the love of a mother can possess villainous aspects.
sentences.chinese: 一個慈母的愛會有它醜惡的一面，想來真使人失望。

sentences.english: In foreign country the people mention the bat thinks of the ugly image.
sentences.chinese: 在番邦，們提到蝙蝠，就想到醜惡兇惡的景。

sentences.english: That succeeded in whipping-up some ugly elements in the Republican party.
sentences.chinese: 這些指控成功的鞭笞了共和黨中一些醜惡的元素。

sentences.english: But Amu concern since a hideous skin will be terrified brothers.
sentences.chinese: 但是阿木憂慮自個醜惡的肌膚會嚇壞兄弟。

sentences.english: The second kind is Frightfulness Type.
But some have argued the government is complicit in the ugliness.
sentences.chinese: 不過也有人認爲，政府與這種醜惡沆瀣一氣。

sentences.english: Prague has grown so ugly lately, said Tereza.
sentences.chinese: 布拉格近來變得這麼醜惡了。

sentences.english: Tartarus was a place of torment where wicked souls were condemned to go.
sentences.chinese: 地獄塔耳塔羅斯是靈魂醜惡的人被罰去受折磨的地方。

sentences.english: Its ugly record of police brutality is known in every section of this country.
sentences.chinese: 該市警察暴行的醜惡記錄全國各地盡人皆知。
希望會醜化醜惡的東西。

sentences.english: The science has caught up and the shamans are exposed.
sentences.chinese: 科學已經迎頭趕上，巫師的醜惡嘴臉終被曝光。

sentences.english: One thing which added still more to the horrors of this garret was, that it was large.
sentences.chinese: 使這破屋顯得更加醜惡的原因是它的面積大。

sentences.english: They should guide people how to tell the truth, goodness and beauty from the fault, ugliness and evil.
sentences.chinese: 他們應該引導人們如何讓辨別真善美與假醜惡。

sentences.english: Dating sites have for the most part always had either a squalid or a chain-store ambience.
sentences.chinese: 相親網站多半有要麼醜惡要麼像連鎖商店一樣的格調。

definition: to turn a blind eye to/to ignore
to ignore/to neglect/to treat with contempt
not the least bit concerned/completely indifferent
to turn a blind eye to
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
